document_data.caption: Cover of Storm King's Thunder
document_data.title: Storm King's Thunder
document_data.editor:
[[Jeremy Crawford]]
[[Kim Mohan]]
[[Michele Carter]]| publisher = [[Wizards of the Coast]]
document_data.cartography: [[Jared Blando]], [[Will Doyle]], [[Jason Engle]], [[Lee Moyer]], [[Christopher Perkins]], [[Mike Schley]]
document_data.edition1: <!-- leave blank if there is only one -->
document_data.mainbody: '''''Storm King's Thunder''''' is a 5th-edition [[Dungeons & Dragons]] adventure set in the [[Savage Frontier]] region of the [[Forgotten Realms]]. It takes four to six characters from levels 1–5 up through level 10. {{Quote|'''''To Fight Giants, You Must Be Giant''''' ''Ages ago, [[giant]]s and [[dragon]]s waged war across the Savage Frontier. These battles are long forgotten by the human civilizations of today, but ancient relics remain. And now, the land shudders once more with the thunder of giant footsteps.'' ''[[Hill giant]]s raid farms for food and livestock, as [[stone giant]]s lay waste to settlements in their path. [[Frost giant]]s plunder coastal towns, as [[fire giant]]s gather slaves. [[Cloud giant]] castles drift across the sky, casting ominous shadows on the cities of [[the North]]. But no threat compares to the wrath of the [[storm giant]]s, who stand betrayed.'' ''Puny adventurers must rise to the challenge, gather their strength, unlock the power of ancient runes, and take the fight to the giants' doorsteps. Only then can they discover a hidden evil fomenting a war between giants and small folk. Only then can they forge an alliance to end the war before it begins.'' ''A Dungeons & Dragons® adventure for characters of levels 1–10. For use with the fifth edition ''[[Player's Handbook 5th edition|Player's Handbook]]''®, ''[[Monster Manual 5th edition|Monster Manual]]''®, and ''[[Dungeon Master's Guide 5th edition|Dungeon Master's Guide]]''®.'' }}
document_data.Chronology: This adventure takes place after the events described in ''[[Hoard of the Dragon Queen]]'' and ''[[The Rise of Tiamat]]'', but does not directly depend on them. It is not set in a particular year, but is assumed to be after the [[1485 DR|Year of the Iron Dwarf's Vengeance, 1485 DR]], and the [[orc]] conflict known as the [[War of the Silver Marches]]. One possible year is the [[1491 DR|Year of the Scarlet Witch, 1491 DR]], as the cloud giant castle that hovers over [[Waterdeep]] during the adventure is also featured in the novel ''[[Death Masks]]''.
